content.description: A square loop with side length <math alttext="0.6 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> is in the plane of the figure. The loop is in a region with a magnetic field of initial magnitude <math alttext="B sub i" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> directed into the plane of the figure, as shown. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the magnitude of the magnetic field is decreased at a constant rate until the magnitude is zero at time <math alttext="t equals 0.1 second" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.1</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>s</mtext> </math>. During this time interval, the induced <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> in the loop is <math alttext="0.5 volt" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mn>0.5</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>V</mtext> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: What is the approximate value of <math alttext="B sub i" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>B</mi> <mi>i</mi> </msub> </math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
